workout_file.author: Zwift
workout_file.name: Week 2.4 - Macro to Micro
workout_file.description: A zone 6 microburst workout with an initial longer effort to mimic the demands of a Zwift race start. ERG off for the micro efforts.

textevent.message: Welcome to this week's Zwift race start workout!
Let's get started with an 8min warmup and we'll chat about today in a few minutes.
Hopefully you feel a little warmer here, let's chat about the plan for today.
Today we'll mimic the specific demands of a Zwift race start.
We'll do so by having a very hard 30sec effort to start.
Then, perform 8 short, but hard efforts to keep the pressure on.
These are known as 'microbursts' since they are only 15sec long with equal rest between.
Let's carry on with the warmup.
Next up, we have 3 high cadence efforts to ensure the legs are awake.
Aim for 100+ RPM for these next efforts.
GO GO GO! Remember I want high cadence here!
Excellent work. Now lower your cadence to something more comfortable.
Spin the legs up again...
And GO GO GO!
Excellent work! Just 1 more to go.
All right, let's take a couple more minutes easy and get ready for the main set.
1min to go, then we're on!
It's best to have ERG off for these efforts.
Remember you can turn ERG off from the Zwift Companion app, or using your keyboard.
And do your best to hit the target wattage, but don't get frustrated if you can't hit it perfectly.
All right, start spinning the legs up and get ready for a hard effort. Aim for 100+ RPM.
GO GO GO! Imagine you're sprinting off the line in a Zwift race.
Bring the power down just a touch, keep the cadence high!
Great! Lower your cadence to bring the power down.
SURGE! Fast cadence again!
Bring the cadence down again.
FAST FEET!
Slow the legs down...You get the idea now.
UP UP UP!
Halfway through this! Keep it up!
C'mon! Just 1 more minute to go!
Phew! Nicely done with that 1st interval. You can turn ERG back on if you like.
We're going to take a full 5min break in between those.
We'll catch up with 1min to go.
All right, 1min to go! Take some deep breaths, start to refocus, and shut ERG off again.
We're going to repeat the same thing with a hard surge to start, then microbursts.
Let's start spinning the legs up again, aim for 100+ RPM ideally.
Get off the line FAST!
Good! Now settle into the group.
Slow the legs down.
Quickly back up to speed!
Slow down again...Breathe.
Let's go!
FAST FEET! Don't slow down here.
Just 1min to go! You can do this!
Superb! Let's take 5min easy again here and catch up with 1min to go :-)
Hopefully you're recovered by now, if not keep taking those deep breaths.
And make sure ERG is off now.
Ready? Start spinning those legs up...
And GO GO GO! Get off the line quickly!
Great job! Stay with the group now.
Ease off the gas.
SURGE! Stay with the group!
Ease up again, lots of pace changes in this group.
GO GO GO!
Keep the pressure on!
Don't let any gaps form! UP UP!
LAST EFFORT!
You are crushing these today! That's 3 down and just 2 to go.
Let's take a nice 5min recovery again here, make sure you're drinking.
Take a couple deep breaths and shake out the upper body.
We're more than halfway through this, you can get to the end!
Make sure ERG is off.
Spin those legs up!
UP UP UP!
Excellent work! Keep the pressure on!
GO GO GO!
Ease up, stay in control.
Attack! GO GO!
PUSH IT! Get to the end of this!
Just 1min left and you're DONE! GO GO!
So good! You are handling these efforts very well.
Let's take it easy for a bit now and freshen up for our finale today.
1min to go before we start the last interval for today!
This is where all the hard work pays off, make me proud!
Spin the legs up!
ATTACK! Get off the line quick!
Keep the pressure on! C'mon now!
SURGE! GO GO GO!
GO! Be aggressive here!
UP UP UP! Just a few surges left!
C'mon! You can do this!
FINAL BURST! GIVE IT EVERYTHING!
Wow! Incredible work today with those efforts.
Those are very difficult, but great bang for the buck and specific to Zwift racing.
We'll spend a few minutes cooling down now, then check off another workout.
See you next time :-)
